content: Simple and smooth gameplay. No frills, but also no ads or odd design quirks.

This is a challenging game compared to others I've played. The scoring setup is a bit unusual and takes some getting used to. I also like having no ads. Yes, I like the game and enjoy playing it. Thank you to the creators.
An old school app, sorta 90ish, but fits the phone vertically, plays easily and the AI doesn't cheat.

I like that you can pay a small fee one time and play offline without adverts or subscription. So far the game works well. One thing -- I can't figure out how to exit the game without going to history or settings and shutting it down.

Losing 5 games in a row (reinstalled game once)became computer gets out first. Something's not right. Uninstalled. P.S.This developer's "hearts" game seems to work a bit more fairly wirh regards to hands deslt.

This is the best gin game I've found, but I have one question that may be  born of my ignorance from only ever playing gin against computers: What is  this "line bonus?" This app is the only computer gin game I've seen it in,  and unless I'm wrong and it's a standard rule I'd like a way to turn it off.  Edit: Ah, thank you!  It was right in front of me, where stuff usually is. :)  I'm not used to the box/"Hollywood" scoring, but know that it's the standard amongst serious gin players.  This is easily the best gin rummy mobile app I've played.
replyContent:
Hi TJ, thanks for your review!

Line bonus is a score variant and not in the traditional scoring method for gin rummy, we use it for quicker game play in the 'simple' scoring mode. If you change to 'traditional' scoring in settings it doesn't apply a line bonus every hand and instead adds a box score at the end of the game. I hope this helps!

content: Needs an undo button. It is too easy to pick the wrong card on a phone.  An undue button is essential to me on a game like this.
